title: Spell Flux not bouncing back.
body:
First game I played as Ryze, and I know for a fact his E is bugged.  It just will not function half the time.  It is basically an overload with a really short range most of the time.  I know for a fact it's not jumping to enemies, but it also might not be shredding MR.  Recommend that a red looks into this.

Edit:  Also, I think the range is bugged too.  I've been able to successfully auto attack an enemy, but unable to hit his E, despite it suppposed to have 50 more range.  It doesn't feel like it's at 600, it feels like it's at 500.  Either that or it's bugging his auto attack's range.   I dunno, Ryze feels really inconsistent right now in terms of his E.

replies.body:
I can promise you that it is in fact jumping between units.

It functions differently now, read the tool tip, and test in a custom.

The Bounce range is small, but shown when you cast.

No, it's not.  It is a crapshoot whether or not the spell actually functions as intended.  It has about a 50% function rate.  This is not unlike Xin Zhao's Q bug, when he'd just fail to knockup his targets because reasons.  

I would not be saying that spell flux isn't functioning if it was.

No, that is not true. You are simply not using it correctly. 

Out of about 10 games after rework I have yet to have this problems

Because I have not personally encountered invisible projectiles, therefore Nidalee's spears and Mundo's cleavers do not turn invisible.

Because I have not personally encountered failure on Quinn's E, therefore Quinn's Vault is perfectly functional.

Real mature kid, I beat you in an argument and you downvote a thread about a champion bug.  SCREW GAME BALANCE, HOW DARE YOU DISAGREE WITH MY WRONG OPINION!

/boards

The bug does not exist, you just suck at landing E's, which is kinda sad

You've now have resorted to simple petty name calling and logical fallacies, so I'm not going to reply to your stupid ass anymore.  You've lost your arguing privileges on my threads.  Do not pass go, do not collect $200.

>You've lost your arguing privileges on my threads

Are you 12?

The range thing happens because autoattack-range is calculated from edge-to-edge of characters hitbox. Most targetted spells calculate center-to-center of characters hitbox.
Example: You can autoattack a six-stack Cho'Gath from a noticable further range than you can target him with spellflux.
